label: developmental and epileptic encephalopathy 105 with hypopituitarism
immunodeficiency 107, susceptibility to invasive staphylococcus aureus infection
ciliary dyskinesia, primary, 48, without situs inversus
narcolepsy, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing narcolepsy.

label: dystonia, dopa-responsive, with or without hyperphenylalaninemia, autosomal recessive
definition: A dopa-responsive dystonia characterized by marked motor delay, but no intellectual disablity, and only minimal, if any, hyperphenylalaninemia.

label: UDP-N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase subunit alpha/beta deficiency
definition: An autosomal recessive mucolipidosis disorder caused by bi-allelic variants in the GNPTAB gene. Symptoms of this condition occur across a clinical spectrum including mucolipidosis type II (ML II) and mucolipidosis type III alpha/beta (ML IIIα/β), and phenotypes intermediate between ML II and ML IIIα/β.

label: toxic bronchiolitis
definition: Bronchiolitis as a response to a toxic exposure.

label: toxic bronchiolitis obliterans
definition: Toxic bronchiolitis whereby a biospy has shown an obliteration of broncioles.

label: tubulinopathy
definition: A nervous system disorder characterized by complex cortical malformations including in most cases dysmorphic basal ganglia in which the cause of the disease is a variation in one or more of the tubulin genes.

label: TUBB3-related tubulinopathy
definition: A tubulinopathy syndrome associated with malformations of cortical development, axon guidance defects, white matter abnormalities, and/or congenital fibrosis of the extraocular muscles (CFEOM), due to de novo or dominantly inherited variants with high penetrance. Individuals may present with variable combinations of malformations of cortical development, dysplasia of the basal ganglia, brainstem, and/or cerebellum, CFEOM, additional cranial nerve involvement, Kallmann syndrome, cyclic vomiting, peripheral neuropathy, and/or contractures. Developmental delays, intellectual disability, ocular motor apraxia, and mirror movements are also frequent features.

label: retinal dystrophy-ataxia-pituitary hormone abnormality-hypogonadism syndrome
definition: An autosomal recessive, multisystem condition caused by pathogenic variants of the PNPLA6 gene, encoding the patatin like phospholipase domain containing 6 protein. RAPH syndrome is characterized by hypogonadism, cerebellar ataxia, retinal dystrophy, peripheral neuropathy, growth hormone deficiency, and cognitive impairment. Additional clinical features may include lower limb spasticity, trichomegaly, alopecia, and facial dismorphism. The term lumps Boucher-Neuhauser, Gordon Holmes, Laurence-Moon, and Oliver-McFarlene syndromes.

label: pulmonary hypertension, neonatal
definition: Abnormally high blood pressure in a newborn child.

label: PPP2R1A-related intellectual disability
definition: Any intellectual disability in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the PPP2R1A gene.

label: desmoid tumor caused by somatic mutation
restless legs syndrome, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing restless legs syndrome.

label: psoriasis, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing psoriasis.

label: leukemia, acute myeloid, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing leukemia, acute myeloid.

label: age related macular degeneration, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing age related macular degeneration.

label: allergic rhinitis, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing allergic rhinitis.

label: dermatitis, atopic, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing atopic dermatitis.

label: Hirschsprung disease, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing Hirschsprung disease.

label: diabetes mellitus, ketosis-prone
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing diabetes mellitus, ketosis.

label: dermatitis, atopic, 1
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing atopic dermatitis. A genomewide linkage study revealed highly significant evidence for linkage on 3q21 (ATOD1) at marker D3S3606.

label: schizophrenia, susceptibility to
definition: An inherited susceptibility or predisposition to developing schizophrenia.

label: radioulnar synostosis, nonsyndromic, susceptibility to
definition: A susceptibility or predisposition to radioulnar synostosis in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the SMAD6 gene.

label: opioid-induced constipation
definition: A constipation disorder caused by use of opiods. OIC may present immediately when a patient takes the opioid, or it may present gradually during opioid therapy.

label: body-stalk anomaly
definition: A very rare anomaly (1 in 14,000 to 42,000 pregnancies; 1 in 7500 fetuses from 10 to 14 weeks of gestation) characterized by a complex anomaly of the anterior abdominal wall, severe kyphoscoliosis, rudimentary umbilical cord, and anatomical defects of the pelvis and lower limbs.

label: proliferative vitreoretinopathy
definition: Vitreoretinal membrane shrinkage or contraction secondary to the proliferation of primarily retinal pigment epithelial cells and glial cells, particularly fibrous astrocytes, followed by membrane formation. The formation of fibrillar collagen and cellular proliferation appear to be the basis for the contractile properties of the epiretinal and vitreous membranes.

label: microcephaly with lissencephaly and/or hydranencephaly
definition: A brain disorder caused by biallelic variants in NDE1 that is characterized by extreme microcephaly (typically head circumference of more than 10 standard deviations (SD) below the mean), profound motor and intellectual disability, spasticity, and incomplete cerebral formation. Radiologic studies demonstrate overt microcephaly with cortical dysgenesis ranging from simplification to pachygyria/lissencephaly to hydranencephaly. Agenesis of the corpus callosum as well as hypoplasia of the brainstem and cerebellum are typically present.

label: SLC6A3-related dopamine transporter deficiency syndrome
definition: A complex movement disorder characterized by tremor, rigidity, bradykinesia, chorea, reduced facial expression, and Parkinsonism-dystonia. This disease is caused by loss of function variants in the SLC6A3 gene, which impair the dopamine transporter protein. The onset of this disease ranges from infancy to adulthood.

label: atypical dopamine transporter deficiency syndrome
definition: A subset of SLC6A3-related DTDS cases which have later onset which ranges from late childhood to adulthood. This disorder is characterized by the presentation of parkinsonism-dystonia, rigidity, tremor, and bradykinesia after normal childhood development.

label: calvarial doughnut lesions with bone fragility and spondylometaphyseal dysplasia
epidermolysis bullosa dystrophica with subcorneal cleavage
retinitis pigmentosa 94, variable age at onset
congenital disorder of glycosylation, type Ibb
short-rib thoracic dysplasia 7/20 with polydactyly, digenic
peroxisome biogenesis disorder, complementation group K
carbon monoxide poisoning
definition: A poisoning that is caused by exposure to carbon monoxide.

label: developmental delay, epilepsy, and neonatal diabetes 1
developmental delay, epilepsy, and neonatal diabetes 2
cessium poisoning
definition: A heavy metal poisoning that is caused by exposure to cessium.

label: iron poisoning
definition: A heavy metal poisoning that is caused by exposure to iron. Iron toxicity is classified as corrosive or cellular. Ingested iron can cause direct caustic injury to the gastrointestinal mucosa, resulting in nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea.

label: organophosphate poisoning
definition: A poisoning that is caused by exposure to organophosphate.

label: sulfur mustard poisoning
definition: A poisoning that is caused by exposure to sulfur mustard. The effects of mustard poisoning may be local, systemic, or both, depending on environmental conditions, exposed organs, and the extent and duration of exposure. The toxic effects of mustard include inhibition of mitosis, NAD depletion, decreased tissue respiration and finally cell death.

label: cardiac glycoside intoxication
definition: A poisoning that is caused by exposure to cardiac glycoside.

label: monochloroacetic acid poisoning
definition: A poisoning that is caused by exposure to monochloroacetic acid.

label: chemotherapy-induced toxicity
definition: Toxicities following administration of chemotherapeutic agents

label: EYS-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the EYS gene.

label: GNAT2-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the GNAT2 gene.

label: IDH3B-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the IDH3B gene.

label: MERTK-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the MERTK gene.

label: PRPF31-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by variants in the PRPF31 gene.

label: GPR179-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the GPR179 gene.

label: GRM6-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the GRM6 gene.

label: ADAM9-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the ADAM9 gene.

label: RP1-related recessive retinopathy
definition: An autosomal dominant retinopathy caused by variants in the RP1 gene.

label: RP1-related dominant retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the RP1 gene.

label: CERKL-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the CERKL gene.

label: TRPM1-related retinoapthy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the TRPM1 gene.

label: CNGB1-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the CNGB1 gene.

label: PCARE-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the PCARE gene.

label: CNGA1-related retinopathy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the CNGA1 gene.

label: ABCA4-related retinoapthy
definition: An inherited retinopathy caused by bi-allelic variants in the ABCA4 gene.

label: NYX-related retinoapthy
definition: An X-linked retinopathy caused by variants in the NYX gene.
